provisions.title: Notification of system breach
provisions.text: Any person who owns or licenses computerized data that includes personal information concerning a Utah resident shall, when the person becomes aware of a breach of system security, provide notification to the affected Utah resident. The person shall provide notification in the most expedient time possible without unreasonable delay. A person who owns or licenses computerized data that includes personal information and discovers a breach of system security relating to the personal information shall also provide notification to the attorney general.

provisions.title: Consumer rights under UCPA
provisions.text: A consumer has the right to: (1) confirm whether or not a controller is processing the consumer's personal data and access the personal data; (2) delete personal data that the consumer has provided to the controller; (3) obtain a copy of the consumer's personal data in a portable and readily usable format that allows the consumer to transmit the data to another controller; and (4) opt out of the processing of the consumer's personal data for purposes of targeted advertising or sale of personal data.
